brief.brief: Auditing enables Service Manager to check fields within a database for modifications when updating records.
Auditing provides an alternative to paging. You can use it to keep track of record updates when paging (creating a new record for every update) is not available.

detail.detail: Auditing detects field modifications by comparing the fields in the original version of a record to the updated version. When the auditing routine finds a modification, it makes an Audit Log entry recording the name of the modified field, the old version of the data; the current date and time, and the current operator's user ID.
